items.text: Session logging procedure: Start session with timestamp and intent, add timestamped entries to Work Log, end session with timestamp, generate Session Summary.
Session logging procedure with timestamps, intent, and status.
Goal creation process including naming convention and progress tracking.
Operational state snapshot creation process.
Process for routing Figma items to the UI Component Library project.
Process for distributing PRDs to Build Factory projects or domain pillars.
Process for creating project scaffolds with 9-folder structure.
Process for creating state snapshots in the Navigation Centre.
Process for creating goal folders with progress tracking.

7-Day Build Sprint: Day 1-2: Foundation + AI concierge engine; Day 3-4: Visitor intelligence + lead capture + scoring; Day 5: Routing + analytics; Day 6: Automation + Docker packaging; Day 7: Marketing site + launch prep.

Remotion Video Workflow: 1. User provides brand assets + UI screenshots. 2. User writes storyboard using motion lexicon terms. 3. Claude writes Remotion React code. 4. `npx remotion render` â†’ MP4 output.

Knowledge Base Ingestion: 1. Website scrape (daily auto-refresh). 2. File upload (CSV/PDF/Word). 3. Google Sheets sync (hourly refresh). 4. CRM integration (Reapit, Alto, Jupix, Expert Agent APIs). 5. API webhook (real-time updates).
Design Workbench: Use Fabric.js canvas + Figma API renderer + component browser from PostgreSQL to mock up screens from 38 UI kits.
Deployment: Dedicated container model uses one Docker Compose per client, deployed via a script taking ~30 minutes.
Figma API import process for kits into PostgreSQL.
Boilerplate coverage analysis workflow: analyze 38 kits against 15 page-need categories across 4 builds.
Screen inventory correction process for project design directories.
UI Assembly Pipeline: Must start from actual Figma designs, not invent components.
Figma Conversion Workflow: Open Figma file -> select frame -> run Anima plugin -> copy generated React code -> repeat per frame. (No batch URL mode exists).
Library Build Order: 1. Convert component pages. 2. Convert key screens. 3. Decompose & tokenize output into library components.
Session Onboarding: Need to standardize what documentation gets read at session start to reduce context loading cost.
7-day build sprint defined: Day 1-2 Foundation+AI, Day 3-4 Visitor+Capture, Day 5 Routing+Analytics, Day 6 Automation+Packaging, Day 7 Marketing+Launch.
Knowledge base ingestion via 5 methods: website scrape, file upload, Google Sheets sync, CRM API, webhook.
Update delivery via Watchtower for nightly Docker pulls and numbered idempotent migrations.
Multi-branch support via branch parameter in pixel and per-branch knowledge base in the same container.
Video production workflow using Remotion + Claude.
Session archival workflow for the Knowledge Library is now working.
Daily working practices defined in PIL_10_WORKING_PRACTICES/DAILY_PRACTICES.md.
Daily routine: run v7_daily.py, start session, paste LLM bootstrap prompt, work, end session.
Session management protocol: session start/end/log/status commands with DB rows and markdown logs.
Consolidation workflow: inventory external sources, deduplicate by hash, move only approved groups.
File scanning workflow: walk filesystem, hash (SHA-256), classify, extract metadata, update DB with diff detection.
ChromaDB sync workflow: process markdown files with heading-aware splitting, generate local embeddings, store in chromadb_data directory.
Locked-in a 6-stage process documented in BUILD_FACTORY_PIPELINE.md.

Process involves: 1. Data arrives (batch export, PRDs), 2. Zero in (cross-reference, identify key pages), 3. Convert (start Anima conversions), 4. Decompose + tokenize output, 5. Architecture (PRD MK11, working practices), 6. Assembly.
5-phase pipeline: 1) Deep JSON extract, 2) Structure analyzer, 3) Layout deduplicator, 4) PNG export, 5) PRD matcher.
End-to-end workflow from PRD to React assembly defined in methodology doc.
Scaling plan for processing 40 kits.
Integration workflow with Enterprise OS pillars.
Session logging protocol: create logs in `02_COMMAND_DECK/ACTIVE_SESSIONS/` and `04_KNOWLEDGE_LIBRARY/SESSION_ARCHIVE/`.
Database loading workflow into PostgreSQL (8-table schema).
Visual browser workflow (localhost thumbnail grid with Anima conversion).
Daily Habit: Sit down > python v7_daily.py > session start > paste LLM prompt > work > session end > stand up.
Daily Runner (v7_daily.py) workflow: single command runs diff > scan > health > snapshot > stale; --quick flag for abbreviated check.
Consolidation process: inventory > dedup > plan > execute --group X --approved (copies with checkpoints, never deletes).
Session tracking: session start/end/log/status commands with DB + markdown logs.
Registry scanning: scan for full filesystem scan, scan --diff for changes since last scan.
5-phase pipeline: 1. Deep Extract, 2. Structure Analyze, 3. Layout Deduplicate, 4. Export Representative PNG, 5. PRD Layout Match.
End-to-end workflow from PRD to assembled React pages defined in methodology document.
Local token setup: `export FIGMA_TOKEN="your_token_here"` before running scripts.
Process for creating a state snapshot.
Workflow for running a weekly DeepSeek review (covering specific sections).
Session wrap-up procedure automated via script.
5-phase pipeline for processing UI kits.
Section-by-section fetch (e.g., Dashboard, Messages, Tasks, Events, Projects, Settings, Sign up & Onboarding, Integrations) as a fallback for connection errors.
Targeted node extraction for files returning HTTP 400 (file too large).
Kit Index Update: Remove unconfirmed kits, add user-specified kits, regenerate markdown documentation.
Figma Extraction: Use Figma API with token to extract kit items, save JSON, import to PostgreSQL ui_library database.
Screen Inventory Correction: Update markdown files based on user specifications for each platform.
Architecture Review: Extract and read Notebook EnterpriseOS summary files (MD, PNG).
Coverage Analysis: Run kit_coverage.py to map kits against page-need categories and identify best kits per page per build.
Targeted Selection: After analysis, drill down per screen: features, user flows, required blocks, specific components from primary kit. Use Figma API for targeted searches, not broad browsing.
